definition: to ask for sth back/to recover
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: I asked her for the money she owed me, but she just fobbed me off with a stupid excuse.
sentences.chinese: 我向她讨还欠款，她却胡乱找个借口把我搪塞过去。

definition: to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
A debt of blood must be paid in blood./Blood calls for blood.
both principal and interest/capital plus profit
to write off at one stroke
for every grievance someone is responsible, for every debt there is a debtor (idiom)/when settling disputes one should not involve third parties

definition: to carry out a vendetta against sb
